message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.CR 

This paper discusses the evaluation of individual scientists based on the number of highly cited publications, which is a common topic in computer science research. The paper specifically mentions the use of this indicator in the field of computer science, which suggests that it may belong to one of the sub-categories that are more closely related to this field. The sub-categories that are most likely to be relevant to this paper are cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.CY (Computers and Society), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). These sub-categories are all related to different aspects of computer science research, such as data analysis, information retrieval, and security, which are all relevant to the topic of evaluating scientists based on their publications.
